attributes.comment:
I am very concerned about the proposed increase in fees in regards to the
immigration process. We have just brought home our second child from Korea
and the expense of this process is making it unaffordable to people that can not
have a child through the birthing process.

In our process, the government states that as soon as the adoption is final, the
child automatically becomes a citizen of the United States. However, for whatever
reason we are required to pay a fee to change the records of our children from
Permanent Resident to Citizen of the US. So the fact that you also want to
increase the fees for a child that is already a citizen is ridiculous.

I would like you to reconsider the proposal to increase these fees. Maybe some
consideration should be made to exclude US citizens that are adopting children
from abroad and apply the fees to citizens of other countries that want to
immigrate to the US and become citizens.

Thank you for your consideration.
Carol S. McDonald

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Carol S. McDonald
